sen.j: 新田分知（しんでんぶんち）とは、江戸時代における武家の分家形態の一つである。
sen.e: Shindenbunchi is a form of samurai branch family in the Edo period.
Shindenbunchi is a form of samurai branch family in the Edo period.
Shindenbunchi is a form of samurai branch family in the Edo period.

sen.j: 分家の創設の際に、主君から与えられた領地ではなく入封後新規に開発した領地（新田）を分与する方式である。
sen.e: When a branch family is established, the family is given a territory newly developed after entering into a new domain, not a territory given by the lord.
When a branch family is established, the family is given a territory newly developed after entering into a new domain, not a territory given by the lord.
When a branch family is established, the family is given a territory newly developed after entering into a new domain, not a territory given by the lord.

sen.j: これにより、本家の表高を減少させずに分家を創設する事が出来る。
sen.e: That made it possible to establish a branch without the head family losing its omote-daka (family without losing its omote-daka (face value of kokudaka assessed by the feudal government).
That made it possible to establish a branch family without losing its omote-daka (face value of kokudaka assessed by the feudal government).
sen.cmt: 不要箇所を削除しました。
sen.e: That made it possible to establish a branch family without losing its omote-daka (face value of kokudaka assessed by the feudal government).

sen.j: 大名および旗本の分家の際に多く認められる。
sen.e: This could be often seen when daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) established branch families.
This could be often seen when daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) established branch families.
This could be often seen when daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) established branch families.

sen.j: 大名家の新田分知において分家も1万石以上の石高がある場合、分家のことを○○新田藩と称することがある。
sen.e: When the branch family of a daimyo had more than ten thousands Goku crop yields in the territory given as shindenbunchi, the branch family might be called XX Nitta domain.

When the branch family of a daimyo had more than ten thousands koku (approximately 1.8 million liters of crop yield) in the territory given as shindenbunchi, the branch family might be called XX Shinden-han (domain).
sen.cmt: 「石」はデータベースに合わせて説明を補足し、「新田藩」は「しんでんはん」の方が一般的と思われますので変更しました。
sen.e: When the branch family of a daimyo had more than ten thousands koku (approximately 1.8 million liters of crop yield) in the territory given as shindenbunchi, the branch family might be called XX Shinden-han (domain).

sen.j: 以下においては、大名家のケースを中心に記述するが、特に注釈しない場合は旗本の場合も同様である。
sen.e: Cases with daimyo will be mainly explained below, but the same is true of other cases.
Cases with daimyo will be mainly explained below, but the same is true in hatamoto except as otherwise noted.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて、後半を補足しました。
sen.e: Cases with daimyo will be mainly explained below, but the same is true in hatamoto except as otherwise noted.

sen.j: 新田分知の形態には、次のようなものがある。
sen.e: The forms of shindenbunchi are as follows: distributing a specific territory appointed (a branch family of Matsudaira clan Matsue Domain), distributing an appointed territory but giving the income from the territory as rice stored by the head family (a branch family of Satake clan, Kubota Domain), and giving income only without designating territory to be distributed (a branch family of Asano clan, Hiroshima Domain).
The forms of shindenbunchi are as follows.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処により、原文・訳文ともに修正しました。
sen.e: The forms of shindenbunchi are as follows.

sen.j: 具体的な領地を指定して分与する（松江藩松平氏の分家など）。
sen.e: A specifically appointed territory distributed (e.g. a branch family of the Matsudaira clan of Matsue Domain).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処により、原文・訳文ともに修正しました。
sen.e: A specifically appointed territory distributed (e.g. a branch family of the Matsudaira clan of Matsue Domain).

sen.j: 領地を指定して分与するが、そこからの収入は本家から蔵米で支給する（久保田藩佐竹氏の分家など）。
sen.e: An appointed territory distributed, but the income from the territory as rice stored provided by the head family (e.g. a branch family of the Satake clan of Kubota Domain).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処により、原文・訳文ともに修正しました。
sen.e: An appointed territory distributed, but the income from the territory as rice stored provided by the head family (e.g. a branch family of the Satake clan of Kubota Domain).

sen.j: 分与する領地を指定せず、収入のみを本家から支給する（広島藩浅野氏の分家など）。
sen.e: Only income provided by the head family without designating territory to be distributed (a branch family of the Asano clan of Hiroshima Domain).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処により、原文・訳文ともに修正しました。
sen.e: Only income provided by the head family without designating territory to be distributed (a branch family of the Asano clan of Hiroshima Domain).

sen.j: いずれのケースにおいても分家の領地は新田高として本来の領地である本田高と区別される。
sen.e: In either case, the territory of a branch family was recognized as a new paddy on newly reclaimed land and was distinguished from originally registered rice paddies. Omote-daka of the head family did not change when a branch family was deprived of samurai status due to succeeding the head family and its territory was returned to the head family.
In any case, the territory of a branch family was recognized as a new paddy on newly reclaimed land and was distinguished from originally registered rice paddies.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In any case, the territory of a branch family was recognized as a new paddy on newly reclaimed land and was distinguished from originally registered rice paddies.

sen.j: また、分家が本家を相続するなどして改易され分知領が本家に返されても本家の表高は変化しない。
sen.e: Also, omote-daka of the head family did not change even when the samurai status of the branch family was changed due to succeeding the head family and its territory was returned to it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also, omote-daka of the head family did not change even when the samurai status of the branch family was changed due to succeeding the head family and its territory was returned to it.

sen.j: ただし、転封の多い譜代大名や旗本の場合は、特に手続きもなく分家の領地が本田高として扱われるようになるケースがある。
sen.e: However, in the cases of fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family) and hatamaoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) whose were often transferred from one fief to another, the territory of a branch family was sometimes treated as a registered rice paddy with no specific procedure.

However, in the cases of fudai daimyo (daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family) and hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) who were often transferred from one fief to another, the territory of a branch family was sometimes treated as a registered rice paddy with no specific procedure.
sen.cmt: スペルミス等を修正しました。
sen.e: However, in the cases of fudai daimyo (daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family) and hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu) who were often transferred from one fief to another, the territory of a branch family was sometimes treated as a registered rice paddy with no specific procedure.

sen.j: 例えば、磐城平藩7万石の内藤氏は1.の形式の新田分知により1万石を分与し湯長谷藩を創設したが、延岡藩転封時に与えられた7万石の領地には湯長谷藩の分が含まれていなかった。
sen.e: For example, Naito clan of Iwakitaira Domain whose crop yields were 70,000 Goku received 10,000 Goku and established Yunagaya Domain as shindenbunchi in the form of 1 above, but the territory of 70,000 Goku given with the relocation of Nobeoka Domain did not include the territory for Yunagaya Domain.

For example, the Naito clan of Iwakitaira Domain whose crop yields were 70,000 koku received 10,000 koku and established Yunagaya Domain as shindenbunchi in the form of 1, but the territory of 70,000 koku given with the relocation of Nobeoka Domain did not include the territory for Yunagaya Domain.
sen.cmt: 用語統一リストに合わせて、「石」をkokuに変更し、clanにtheを補足しました。
sen.e: For example, the Naito clan of Iwakitaira Domain whose crop yields were 70,000 koku received 10,000 koku and established Yunagaya Domain as shindenbunchi in the form of 1, but the territory of 70,000 koku given with the relocation of Nobeoka Domain did not include the territory for Yunagaya Domain.

sen.j: 湯長谷藩の領地は岩城平藩の新田であるので、本家が転封されても分家の領地は本家の領地内に設定されなければならない。
sen.e: The territory of Yunagaya Domain was a new paddy, therefore it should be should be set within the territory of the head family.
Since the territory of Yunagaya Domain was a new paddy of Iwakitaira Domain, the territory of the branch family should be included in that of the head family even if the head family was relocated.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れを追記し、全体を変更しました。
sen.e: Since the territory of Yunagaya Domain was a new paddy of Iwakitaira Domain, the territory of the branch family should be included in that of the head family even if the head family was relocated.

sen.j: しかし実際には、湯長谷藩の領地は延岡藩とは独立に本田とされている。
sen.e: In reality, however, the territory of the Yunagaya clan was regarded as a registered rice paddy independent from Nobeoka clan.
In reality, however, the territory of Yunagaya Domain was regarded as a registered rice paddy independent from Nobeoka Domain.
In reality, however, the territory of Yunagaya Domain was regarded as a registered rice paddy independent from Nobeoka Domain.

sen.j: 新田分知を受けた者であっても江戸幕府からは通常の大名旗本と同様に扱われるが、その領地の治政は多くの場合本家に依存して独自の治績が残ることは希である。
sen.e: Even those who received shindenbunchi were treated equally as ordinary daimyo or hatamoto, but the administration of their territories was, in most cases, dependent on their head families and their unique administration was a rare case.

Even those who received shindenbunchi were treated equally as ordinary daimyo or hatamoto, but the administration of their territories was, in most cases, dependent on their head families and their unique administration was a rare case.

Even those who received shindenbunchi were treated equally as ordinary daimyo or hatamoto, but the administration of their territories was, in most cases, dependent on their head families and their unique administration was a rare case.

sen.j: 新田藩のうち幕末まで存続した藩は明治維新時に独自の陣屋を設けたり本藩に吸収されたりしたため、維新後には新田藩と称される藩は存在しない。
sen.e: Nitta clans who survived by the end of the Edo period no longer existed after the Meiji Restoration because independent jinya (regional government office) was established or they were absorbed by their head families.

Shinden domains which survived by the end of the Edo period no longer existed after the Meiji Restoration because independent jinya (regional government office) was established or they were absorbed by their head families.
sen.cmt: 新田藩の訳を修正しました。
sen.e: Shinden domains which survived by the end of the Edo period no longer existed after the Meiji Restoration because independent jinya (regional government office) was established or they were absorbed by their head families.

sen.j: 新田藩の例
sen.e: Cases of Nitta clan
Cases of Shinden domain
sen.cmt: 新田藩の訳を修正しました。
sen.e: Cases of Shinden domain

sen.e: Shirakawa Shinden domain of Shirakawa Domain, Mutsu Province - the Matsudaira clan (composed of two domains of the Echizen Matsudaira family and the Okudaira clan)
